factoid: Anna Pávlovna’s drawing room was gradually filling.
The highest Petersburg society was assembled in Anna Pávlovna’s drawing room.
People in the highest Petersburg society differed widely in age.
People in the highest Petersburg society differed widely in character.
People in the highest Petersburg society were alike in the social circle to which they belonged.
Prince Vasíli’s daughter Hélène came to take Prince Vasíli to the ambassador’s entertainment.
Hélène wore a ball dress.
Hélène wore her badge as maid of honor.
Princess Bolkónskaya was present in Anna Pávlovna’s drawing room.
Princess Bolkónskaya was known as la femme la plus séduisante de Pétersbourg.
Princess Bolkónskaya was the most fascinating woman in Petersburg.
Princess Bolkónskaya had been married during the previous winter.
Princess Bolkónskaya was pregnant.
Princess Bolkónskaya did not attend large gatherings.
Princess Bolkónskaya attended only small receptions.
Prince Vasíli’s son Hippolyte came to the gathering.
Hippolyte came with Mortemart.
Hippolyte introduced Mortemart.
The Abbé Morio attended the gathering.
Many others attended the gathering.
Anna Pávlovna said to each new arrival, “You have not yet seen my aunt,” or “You do not know my aunt?”
Anna Pávlovna conducted each new arrival to a little old lady.
The little old lady wore large bows of ribbon in her cap.
The little old lady had come sailing in from another room as soon as the guests began to arrive.
Anna Pávlovna mentioned each visitor's name to the old lady.
Anna Pávlovna left the visitors after mentioning names.
Each visitor greeted the old aunt.
No visitor knew the old aunt.
No visitor wanted to know the old aunt.
No visitor cared about the old aunt.
Anna Pávlovna observed the greetings with mournful and solemn interest.
Anna Pávlovna observed the greetings with silent approval.
The old aunt spoke to each visitor in the same words.
The old aunt spoke about each visitor's health.
The old aunt spoke about her own health.
The old aunt spoke about the health of Her Majesty.
Her Majesty was better today.
Each visitor left the old woman with a sense of relief at having performed a vexatious duty.
Each visitor did not return to the old woman during the whole evening.
Princess Bolkónskaya brought some work in a gold-embroidered velvet bag.
Princess Bolkónskaya had a pretty little upper lip.
A delicate dark down was perceptible on Princess Bolkónskaya's upper lip.
Princess Bolkónskaya's upper lip was too short for her teeth.
Princess Bolkónskaya's upper lip lifted all the more sweetly.
Princess Bolkónskaya's upper lip was especially charming when she occasionally drew it down to meet the lower lip.
Princess Bolkónskaya's defect was the shortness of her upper lip and her half-open mouth.
Princess Bolkónskaya's defect seemed to be her own special and peculiar form of beauty.
Everyone brightened at the sight of Princess Bolkónskaya.
Princess Bolkónskaya was soon to become a mother.
Princess Bolkónskaya was full of life and health.
Princess Bolkónskaya carried her burden so lightly.
Old men who looked at Princess Bolkónskaya felt as if they were becoming full of life and health.
Dull dispirited young ones who looked at Princess Bolkónskaya felt as if they were becoming full of life and health.
All who talked to Princess Bolkónskaya saw her bright smile.
All who talked to Princess Bolkónskaya saw the constant gleam of her white teeth.
All who talked to Princess Bolkónskaya thought they were in a specially amiable mood that day.
Princess Bolkónskaya went round the table with quick, short, swaying steps.
Princess Bolkónskaya had her workbag on her arm.
Princess Bolkónskaya gaily spread out her dress.
Princess Bolkónskaya sat down on a sofa near the silver samovar.
Princess Bolkónskaya's actions seemed to be a pleasure to herself and to those around her.
Princess Bolkónskaya said, “I have brought my work.”
Princess Bolkónskaya displayed her bag.
Princess Bolkónskaya addressed all present.
Princess Bolkónskaya said, “Mind, Annette, I hope you have not played a wicked trick on me.”
Princess Bolkónskaya turned to her hostess.
Princess Bolkónskaya said, “You wrote that it was to be quite a small reception, and just see how badly I am dressed.”
Princess Bolkónskaya spread out her arms to show her short-waisted, lace-trimmed, dainty gray dress.
Princess Bolkónskaya's dress was girdled with a broad ribbon just below the breast.
Anna Pávlovna replied, “Soyez tranquille, Lise, you will always be prettier than anyone else.”
Princess Bolkónskaya said, “You know, my husband is deserting me? He is going to get himself killed. Tell me what this wretched war is for?”
Princess Bolkónskaya addressed Prince Vasíli with that statement.
Princess Bolkónskaya turned to speak to Prince Vasíli’s daughter Hélène after that.
Prince Vasíli said, “What a delightful woman this little princess is!” to Anna Pávlovna.
